reviews.review: This game is not a lie
Portal 2 is a worthy second part to the original idea. Incredibly fun and lots of potential due to user-provided custom maps. Definitely recommended!

Absolutely love this game. At face value its a puzzle game, but its so much more than that. Theres much lore and mystery that surrounds it. The comedic antics of Wheatley combined with the maternal sarcasm from GlaDos definately add much to the game also. The multiplayer gameplay and the campaign are very well thought out. Really, I wouldnt change a thing. 15/10 Would buy again!

Для меня Portal 2 - лучшая игра от Valve. По сравнению с первой частью, она намного длиннее и сложнее. Интересный сюжет, занимательный геймплей, да и графика приятна на глаз. Также есть кооператив, чтобы на пару с другом тупить над новыми головоломками.
Если вы ещё не поиграли в Portal 2, рекомендую это сделать. Моя оценка: 10 литров геля из 10
P.S. Уитли ШИКАРЕН :D
P.P.S. Игра получает от меня номинацию премии Steam в категории "Проверено временем". Имхо, она того заслуживает ;)

Review Of Portal2 By Primyy
-
Extremely fun game by Valve, challenges your mind and also has some great comedy.

Pros
- Great puzzles, really challenged me and got stuck a few times, even more if you are new to portal.
- Nice comedy, made me laugh :)
- Overall great game combining comedy, first person, and puzzle gaming.

Cons
- Game is a bit short, but can be extended with many free mods / addons like "mel" and co-op play.
- error 404 no more cons found :)

Conclusion:

Rate: 8/10
Summary: Fun / Challenging game for a great price, especially when on sale, must have game for puzzle people!
YESSSS
BEST GAME EVER! HIGHLY RECEMENDED! 11/10 (Needs more Cave Johnson though, and f-stop).

Lovely game. The single player story is gripping and satisfying, and you learn more about the world that you came to love in the first Portal game. The co-op experience was one of the best I've played with my friend on the other side of the country.

Alors quoi dire...
Ce jeu est terrible, je ne pensais pas accrocher autant que ça, ça en deviens une addiction même pour dire !

Il y avait un clin d'œil à ce jeu dans "The Stanley parable" ou il y avait une scène du jeu.
Ce jeu est vraiment fantastique, déjà il est vraiment très bien fait, on se prend vraiment au jeu.

Les graphiques sont très bons et le scénario, disons pas mal...
L'éditeur de salle est quant à lui excellent je trouve.

Il manque cependant peut être des modèle de salle de départ, petite moyen, grande et
aussi des modèle de salle pleine mais c'est pas grave ça, ce serait juste un plus.

Ce qui est dommage je trouve et se serais un plus non négligeable mais pas
simple à mettre en place je pense, faire nos salle et que une intelligence
artificiel face elle-même la salle, un robot par exemple.

Se serrais délirant je trouve ^^

Je trouve vraiment l'éditeur très bon, très simple et très bon, j'adore, terrible !

Dans ce jeu vous devez trouver votre chemin jusque la sortie
en résolvent des énigmes si je peux dire pour avancer dans la salle.

Il y a des blocks, des lasers, des passerelles (Ponts), des tunnels et j'en passes.
Vous devez avec tous ses éléments vous frayer un chemin dans la salle.

Vous avez aussi votre outils indispensable qui sans lui vous ne feriez pas grand-chose.
Votre outil portail, un bleu et un orange, vous pouvez les placer sur les dalle grise clair car
ya que là où vous pouvez les placer puis vous déplacer ainsi...

Le jeu se déroule ainsi, de salle en salle du plus facile au plus dur
mais parfois non linéaire, des fois se serra plus simple et d'autre fois plus dur.

Trouvez votre chemin avec tous les éléments présent dans la salle jusque
la sortie pour passer à la suivante tout en suivent la simple histoire.

Ce jeu est vraiment passionnant, on s'attache au jeu et aux personnages.
Pour moi très très bon jeu.

La narration est très bonne aussi (ma préférer est avec Cave Johnson).

L'éditeur de salle vous permet de créer vos propres salles pour ensuite
les refaire seule (Et en coopération surement).

Vous pouvez aussi publier vos salles mais aussi en faire...
Bref, si vous aimer les jeux d'énigmes et chercher, ce jeu est fait pour vous.

Parfois j’ai mis pas mal de temps à passer une salle (Entre 30 mn et 2h peut être je ne sais plus)
mais c’était toujours avec plaisir.

J’ai utilisé une seule fois Google pour une salle vers la fin alors que ce n’était pas si
Compliqué que ça (La honte) et parfois j’ai même résolue des énigmes sans
le faire exprès, ça m’est arrivé plusieurs fois.

Attention, ce jeu est méchamment addictif !
Vous allez avoir besoin de toutes vos neurones !

Par contre le jeu est pas très long, dommage...
Je vais me faire le 1 tient ^^

Portal 2 - Интересная логическая игра, знаменитая всем! Игра, увлекает игрока с первой минуты. Много различных шуток, смешных моментов, качественная озвучка, не оставит вас скучать. Много логических уровней, где вам придётся напрягать свой мозг.

Holy crap this was an amazing gaming experience, exponentially better than I expected, good work folks. I had a problem with the smoothness of the game, though. particularly in the dialogue and movie-like settings. I remedied this by activating the captions. Dear god this was a great game. dude really though, I cant stress enough how much time I waisted trying to fix that A/V problem. I switched to four different computers because I thought it would affect the gameplay. I can affirm that it did not affect the gameplay, just the cut-scenes and the dialogues. Weairdly, J.K. Simmons never skipped once. Truly a testament to his accumen as a voice actor.

"The situation you are in is very dangerous."
"The liklihood of you dying within the next five minutes is 87.61%."
"You are about to get me killed."
"We will both die because of your negligence."
"This is a bad plan. You will fail."
"He will most likely kill you. Violently."
"He will most likely kill you."
"You will be dead soon."
"The situation is hopeless."
"You are going to die in this room."
"You could stand to lose a few pounds."
"The Fact Sphere is the most intelligent sphere."
"The Fact Sphere is the most handsome sphere."
"The Fact Sphere is incredibly handsome."
"The Fact Sphere is always right."
"The Adventure Sphere is a blowhard and a coward."
"The Space Sphere will never go to space."
"You will never go into space."
"Fact: Space does not exist."
"Spheres that insist on going into space are inferior to spheres that don't."
"The Fact Sphere is a good person, whose insights are relevant."
"The Fact Sphere is a good sphere, with many friends."
"Whoever wins this battle is clearly superior, and will earn the allegiance of the Fact Sphere."
"The liklihood of you dying violently within the next five minutes is 87.61%."
"The Fact Sphere is not defective. Its facts are wholly accurate, and very interesting."

"Corruption at 50%."
"Warning: Sphere corruption at twenty-r-rr-r-rats cannot throw up."

"The square root of rope is string."
"While the submarine is vastly superior to the boat in every way, over 97% of people still use boats for aquatic transportation."
"Cellular phones will not give you cancer. Only hepatitus."
"Pants were invented in the 16th century to avoid Poseidon's wrath. It was believed that the sight of naked sailors angered the sea god."
"The atomic weight of Germanium is 72.64."
"89% of magic tricks are not magic. Technically, they are sorcery."

"Humans can survive underwater, but not for very long."
"Raseph, the Semetic god of war and plague, had a gazelle growing out of his forehead."

"Polymerase I polypeptide A is a human gene."
"Rats cannot throw up."

"Human tapeworms can grow up to 22.9 meters."
"The Schrodinger's cat paradox outlines a situation in which a cat in a box must be considered, for all intents and purposes, simultaneously alive and dead. Schrodinger created this paradox as a justification for killing cats."
"Every square inch of the human body has 32 million bacteria on it."
"The Sun is 330,330 times the size of Earth."
"The average life expectancy of a rhinoceros living in captivity is 15 years."
"Volcano-ologists are experts in the study of volcanoes."
"Avacados have the highest fiber and calories of any fruit. They are found in Australians."
"The Moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days."

"If you have trouble with simple counting, use the following mneumonic device: One, comes before two, comes before sixty, comes after twelve, comes before six-trillion, comes after five-hundred-and-four. This will make your earlier counting difficulties seem like no big deal."
"A gallon of water weighs 8.34 pounds."
"Hot water freezes quicker than cold water."
"Honey does not spoil."
"The average adult human body contains half a pound of salt."
 "A nanosecond lasts one-billionth of a second."

"China produces the world's second largest crop of soybeans."
"Tungsten has the highest melting point of any metal, at 3,410 degrees Celsius."
"Gently cleaning the tongue twice a day is the most effective way to fight bad breath."
"Roman toothpaste was made with urine. Urine is an ingredient in toothpaste continued to be used up until the 18th century."
"The Tariff Act of 1789, established to protect domestic manufacture, was the second statute ever enacted by the United States government."
"The value of Pi is the ratio of any circle's circumference to its diameter in Euclidean space."
"The Mexican-American War ended in 1848 with the signing of the Treaty of Guadelupe Hidalgo."
"In 1879, Sandford Fleming first produced the adoption of worldwide standardized time zones at the Royal Canadian Institute."

"At the end of The Seagull by Anton Chekhov, Konstantin kills himself."
"Contrary to popular belief, the Eskimo does not have 100 different words for snow. They do, however, have 234 words for fudge."
"In Victorian England, a commoner was not allowed to look directly at the Queen, due to a belief at the time that the poor had the ability to steal thoughts. Science now believes that less than 4% of poor people are able to do this."
"In 1862, Abraham Lincoln signed the Emancipation Proclaimation, freeing the slaves. Like everything he did, Lincoln freed the slaves while sleepwalking, and later had no memory of the event."
"In 1948, at the request of a dying boy, baseball legend Babe Ruth at 75 hot dogs, then died of hot dog poisoning."
"William Shakespeare did not exist. His plays were masterminded in 1589 by Francis Bacon, who used a Ouiji board to enslave playwriting ghosts."
"It is incorrectly noted that Thomas Edison invented push-ups in 1878. Nikolai Tesla had in fact patented the activity three years earlier, under the name "Tesla-cize."
"Whales are twice as intelligent and three times as delicious as humans."
"The automobile brake was not invented until 1895. Before this, someone had to be in the car at all times, driving in circles until passengers returned from their errands."
"Edmund Hilary, the first person to climb Mt. Everest, did so accidentally, while chasing a bird."
"Diamonds are made when coal is put under intense pressure. Diamonds put under intense pressure become foam pellots, commonly used today as packing material."
"The most poisonous fish in the world is the orange ruffy. Everything on its body is made of a deadly poison. The ruffy's eyes are composed of a less harmful deadly poison."
"The occupation of court jester was invented accidentally, when a vassal's epilepsy was mistaken for capering."
"Halley's Comet can be viewed orbiting Earth every seventy-six years. For the other seventy-five, it retreats to the heart of the Sun, where it hibernates undisturbed."
"The first commercial air flight took place in 1914. Everyone involved screamed the entire way."
"In Greek myth, Prometheus stole fire from the gods and gave it to humankind. The jewelry he kept for himself."
"The first person to prove that cow's milk is drinkable was very, very thirsty."
"Before the Wright Brothers invented the airplane, anyone wanting to fly anywhere was required to eat 200 pounds of helium."
"Before the invention of scrambled eggs in 1912, the typical breakfast was either whole eggs still in the shell, or scrambled rocks."
"During the Great Depression, the Tennessee Valley Authority outlawed pet rabbits, forcing many to hot glue-gun long ears onto their pet mice."
"At some point in their lives 1 in 6 children will be abducted by the Dutch."
"To make a photocopier, simply photocopy a mirror."
"Dreams are the subconscious mind's way of reminding people to go to school naked and have their teeth fall out."

Portal 2 is gr8 because it is longer than the original, and it also features 3 new types of gel. Some of the puzzles are very easy, but it becomes tougher later.  The test chambers in Portal 2 are larger when compared to it's predeccessor, but it becomes annoying when you have to search for a small patch of wall that you can shoot a portal at. The graphics have noticeably been improved, and the new character Wheatly is funny.  If you enjoyed the original, you'll probably like this too.

Oyun çok başarılı ve hoş olmuş hem tek oyuncu modu hem çok oyunculu modu gerçekten akıl almaz. İkisindede farklı bir hikaye dönüyor. Benim bugüne kadar oynadığım en iyi hikaye/puzzle oyunlarından bir tanesi şiddetle oyunu almanızı tavsiye ederim tek kişilik modunu bitirdikten sonra arkadaşlarınızla eğlenebileceğiniz çok kişilik modu var. Biriniz P-body biriniz Atlas aldı robotların yerine geçiyorsunuz geçmeniz gereken 5 etap her etapta 5-8 arası bölüm var hepside birbirinden farklı. Eğer yanınızda portal oynayan arkadaşınız yoksa emin olunki tek kişilik modu sizi alıp götürecek bazen seçimler yapmak zorunda kalacaksınız. Atmosferi Muziği Grafiği çok hoşuma gitti. Puan 10 / 10

Following up with Portal 1, Portal 2 is just one of those legendary games that you just must play. The story in general and how they expanded from it since Portal 1 is just amazing. Character development, structure, story development, etc is probably one of the best in years. 10/10 (I also recommend playing Portal 1 because it\s just as good and can be played in an afternoon)

Finishing the game single player and co-op was great. The missions were hard at some points but really good, and i had fun. Really good game I do recomend  to play it. The graphics were brilliant but the story was even better. Amazing game with a big thumbs up.  :D
